result.execSummary:
All charges against Robert P Tallman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert P Tallman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert P Tallman

1:49 PM Defendant Robert P Tallman appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant does not have an attorney yet.  Defendant needs more time to retain counsel/time for SPD to appoint counsel. 
Defendant moves to dismiss all three cases, due to not having preliminary hearing within 20 days of initial appearance.
State will go along with the courts.
BTC: Motion granted to dismiss all three cases without prejudice. State may reissue and set initial for 9/13.
